question: In which of the following years Vasco da Gama discovered the sea route to India?
explanation: Vasco da Gama discovered the sea route to India in 1498 and reached Calicut on Malabar Coast. He sailed to India for the second time with 15 ships and 800 men on 30 October 1502, arriving at Calicut,Â  where the ruler was willing to sign a treaty.
